intro: Leiothrix gounelleana, commonly known as the Gounelle's leiothrix, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in woodland areas and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens despite its relatively rare occurrence in the wild.
